__e: The first one of these I saw, this kid at school had one.
It belonged to a young man who died 14 years ago in the war.
All I know is that bag belongs to a dead man.
But there was a collective responsibility, people belonged to the land; the land did not belong to the people.
And then, at some point I just stopped being the girl who belonged at college. Or anywhere, for that matter.
The first pass through, I found blood that didn't belong to the victim.
So I always felt like I belonged to everyone, you know, a part of my heart, a part of who I am belongs to everybody.
So, I actually found someone who got a name for me... ..and they told me that this person was deceased, and that this name didn't belong to anyone.
And then, at some point I just stopped being the girl who belonged at college. Or anywhere, for that matter.
So the gun belonged to the car owner-- tell me you got a name.
I knew the life, but I didn't wear his patch.
That money was mine if nothing else, at least that...
